text: Speaking of the Active Inference Journal.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So the goal of the Active Inference Journal is to increase the accessibility and the indexability, citability and utility of live streams and various audio visual material produced.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: in and around the Active Inference Institute.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So currently we've been working on around four specific streams and events to improve and template our process that we're hoping to build and scale on further.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: What we do in the journal is we take the outcomes of the live stream, the audio visuals of the live stream, and we get a primary artificial intelligence, AI generated transcript, and then engage in a sequence of enrichments, editing, and curations.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So we edit the transcripts by listening carefully to the audio and making sure that the speaker's sense is to the extent possible captured.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And then we also develop, for example, appendices and other scholarship around the document.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So when somebody mentions a paper or when somebody mentions a person, those kinds of information can be included.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And the discourse can be connected to the active inference ontology in cases where the terms are being used.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And again, that will enable more accessible searching in the language of the live stream.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: For example, people have asked questions that somebody might want to query again, or might want to hear someone's response at a given time too, and cite that or just learn from it.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And then also it's really important to have such standardized pipelines for transcription in order to enable translation into different languages.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Ways that you can get involved in the journal if you're interested or curious in this area, whether you have editing or proofreading experience or not.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: There are many affordances to edit transcripts, so listening carefully to the audio and providing suggested edits on texts.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And also we're especially interested to research and develop methodologies for the journal process.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So anyone familiar or curious about AI-assisted transcription and translation, modular publications, decentralized science and DeSci, the usage of Git as a versioning system, any of these areas, we would welcome your engagement in the journal project.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: because that's the direction that we want to head and that is what is going to unlock some of the potential of the 200 plus live streams that we've already carried out and the many hundreds that we'll carry out in the future it will enable these past and future live streams to be able to be searched cited translated and used more broadly

speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: in terms of their features, their functions, their elements, their areas of application, and so on.
